question: Which of the following facilities is provided by "Edusat" which was launched by ISRO?
explanation: ISRO has dedicated to the nation one of its satellites solely for the education sector. It is called the EDUSAT (also GSAT-3) satellite that was launched on September 20, 2004 from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre, in Sriharikota, Andhra Pradesh by the Geo-Synchronouslaunch vehicle GSLV (F01).
